Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the achievements made against ISIS in the last eight months, implying that it surpasses the progress made in many previous years combined.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or data to support the assertion that more has been achieved against ISIS in the last eight months than in many previous years combined.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the progress made against ISIS in the last eight months is significantly greater than the progress made in previous years, without providing substantial evidence to support this assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: There are alternative explanations for the gains made against ISIS, such as changes in decision-making authority and strategies, which may have contributed to the progress under the current presidency.
